# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    # 1. Split the string into words
    words = split(str)
    # 2. Iterate over the words and add a new line after each word that exceeds the text width
    result = ""
    for word in words
        if length(result) + length(word) <= text_width || isempty(word)
            result *= word
        else
            result *= '\n' * word
        end
    end
    # 3. Return the wrapped string
    return result
end
```

Example usage:
```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello World", 10)
"Hello\nWorld"
```
